basics.name: Jerry Batorski
basics.label: Frontend Software Engineer
summaryOfQualifications: 2.5 years of experience with Angular and Unit/Integration/E2E testing
5 years of experience in C# ASP.NET

8 years of experience with ( SQL reporting and administration in MS SQL Server and Oracle,Full development lifecycle, from requirements gathering, architecting schema and object models, development, to post go live support)
Solid team-player, proactive quick-learner, and independent self-starter
Proponent of building maintainable software with a DevOps mindset

work.name: CDK Global
highlights: As part of a multi team environment, develop the Inventory product within the suite of applications that make up CDK's Front Office Edge based single page application in the automotive dealership industry.
App built using Angular JS and tested with Jasmine/Selenium, utilizing Grunt, RequireJS, ESLint, and Karma in the build process

Developed API services to store configuration settings and generate SEO friendly vehicle descriptions using .NET’s WebAPI and MSSQL 2012, including unit testing of services and version control and CI for database
Helped team come up with a testing strategy encompassing unit, integration, and end to end tests to improve confidence when deploying changes from development to production environments.

Primary resource for configuring and troubleshooting the Continuous Integration pipeline using Git, Bamboo, Grunt, Jasmine/Karma, ESLint, Sonar, SauceLabs, Nolio, Ansible, and Puppet. This included automated gating for code quality, code reviews, and unit/integration/e2e tests.
Helped team and company practice agile as a Scrum Master, mentored junior Product Owner regarding Agile practices, started Scrum discussions with other SM’s to share ideas, problems, and solutions.
Mentored junior and mid-level developers in the practice of unit testing, creating maintainable code, design, and troubleshooting.
Heavily used Confluence to document release, Scrum, and on-boarding procedures, research initiatives, and team strategies.

work.name: Answers Media
highlights: Developed live Q&A session web app utilizing SignalR across load balanced servers with a SQL Server Backplane to facilitate communication between thousands of connected clients. Angular.js was used to create the UI, allow admins to toggle availability of sections in the UI, and push changes via SignalR to all clients.

Utilizing MVC4 razor views, jQuery, and AJAX calls, developed dynamic admin interface with a simple workflow targeted at business users, allowing them to easily create and manage our LMS component with little training.
Expanded and improved in-house CMS built upon C# .NET 4.5, Entity Framework CodeFirst, SQL Server 2012, MVC 4 using Razor engine, and heavy use of jQuery and Ajax.
Where EF wasn’t a fit, built Stored Procedures to handle bulk processing, multipart transactions, and complex queries
Developed IDE like editor to create XHTML templates infused with our custom modules that could be added and configured without page refreshes
Implemented automated build and deploy system using TFS Builds.

work.name: Chicago Public Schools
highlights: Collaborated with a four-member team to design an ASP.NET Online Recruiting System for school based personnel used to collect candidate data, automatically post vacant positions, and to hire candidates. Tight three month schedule resulted in 30,000 applications and 3,200 hires within six months of launching

Developed database, data access layer, and frontend for an internal admin search page with heavy use of jQuery and Ajax calls that populated and handled saving of data for form questions, and a custom security system that handled role-based page and component-level access.

Managed various internal system upgrades including: initiated the use of TFS as a source control system; developed a branching strategy to accommodate multiple development streams; upgraded all systems to .NET 4; introduced logging using Log4Net; and created a deployment and hosting strategy to accommodate the testing of multiple development streams.

Developed a pilot ASP.NET application for principals to submit teacher observation information; the front-end was used by 70 schools to submit over 200 teacher observations and administered by users that could configure system settings, take actions against entered data, and run ondemand reports.
Updated existing applications used by over 700 schools using ASP.NET, HTML, jQuery, and SQL

Wrote SQL reports on a weekly basis against PeopleSoft and internal application data to accommodate administration’s growing needs for system-wide data. These complex reports required information from multiple systems, across historical data, and involving complex business rules.

work.name: Chicago Public Schools
highlights: Developed MS Access based tool to replace effort of 10 temp employees that imported and analyzed PeopleSoft data for retiring employees and integrated the output with externally managed pension fund system
Used ADO to import PeopleSoft data stored in Oracle using ODBC; Analyzed and processed data using series of SQL scripts and VBA modules.
Acted as primary resource for developing SQL reports

work.name: Chicago Public Schools
highlights: Met with users to understand processes and assess needs, gathered functional requirements, and developed MS Access based applications to replace paper based processes; used ODBC connections to Oracle to pull in PeopleSoft employee and payroll data
Built an MS Access based tool used to execute 70 audit queries against Oracle’s PeopleSoft data and export the results for Payroll user analysis during every payroll.
Ran all bi-weekly payroll processes for over 55,000 employees while ensuring data accuracy.

work.name: Chicago Public Schools
highlights: Maintained and updated MS Access based applications used by the payroll department
